Package org.bluezoo.json

Class JSONParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.json.JSONParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JSONLocator
    public class JSONParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements JSONLocator
    A streaming JSON parser using the push (receive) model.

    Unlike traditional parsers that take an InputStream and block during parsing, this parser uses a non-blocking push model:

    • receive(ByteBuffer) - push bytes as they arrive
    • close() - signal end of data

    For convenience, a traditional blocking parse(InputStream) method is also provided which internally delegates to the streaming API.

    Parsing events are delivered via JSONContentHandler as tokens are recognized. The parser maintains internal state between receive() calls using a CompositeByteBuffer for underflow handling.

    Usage (Streaming)

    
 JSONParser parser = new JSONParser();
 parser.setContentHandler(myHandler);
 
 // As bytes arrive...
 parser.receive(chunk1);
 parser.receive(chunk2);
 ...
 parser.close();

    Usage (InputStream)

    
 JSONParser parser = new JSONParser();
 parser.setContentHandler(myHandler);
 parser.parse(inputStream);

    Character Encoding

    The parser assumes UTF-8 encoding by default. BOM detection is performed on the first chunk.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Method Detail

      • setContentHandler

        public void setContentHandler​(JSONContentHandler handler)
        Register a content handler to be notified of parsing events.
        Parameters:
        handler - the content handler

      • parse

        public void parse​(java.io.InputStream in)
           throws JSONException
        Parse a JSON document from an InputStream.

        This is a convenience method that reads the input stream in chunks and delegates to the streaming receive(ByteBuffer) API. The stream is read until EOF, then close() is called.

        Note: This method does not close the InputStream.

        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to parse
        Throws:
        JSONException - if there is a parsing error

      • receive

        public void receive​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
             throws JSONException
        Receive bytes into the parser.

        Bytes are processed immediately. Parsing events are fired to the content handler as tokens are recognized. Incomplete tokens are buffered for the next receive() call.

        Parameters:
        data - the byte buffer to process
        Throws:
        JSONException - if there is a parsing error

      • close

        public void close()
           throws JSONException
        Close the parser, signaling end of input.

        This validates that the JSON document is complete.

        Throws:
        JSONException - if the document is incomplete

      • getLineNumber

        public int getLineNumber()
        Description copied from interface: JSONLocator
        Returns the line number currently being processed. The first line is line 1.
        Specified by:
        getLineNumber in interface JSONLocator
        Returns:
        the current line number

      • getColumnNumber

        public int getColumnNumber()
        Description copied from interface: JSONLocator
        Returns the column number currently being processed. The first column in each line is column 1.
        Specified by:
        getColumnNumber in interface JSONLocator
        Returns:
        the current column number
